crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description: If data within an application needs to be persisted within the users' PHP SESSION, invoking setSessionParam() will send that information to the SESSION...passing it through the encryption layer of the CRNRSTN Suite :: per the configuration settings of the same. Because the openssl encryption library requires the data targeted for encryption to be of string or integer data type, certain data types including objects, arrays, and boolean will be stored in SESSION just as it was received...sans encryption. Integers, float (or double) and...of course...string data types are able to be processed by the openssl library.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11

Because the mcrypt ciphers require the data targeted for encryption to be of string data type, certain data types including objects, arrays, boolean will be stored in SESSION just as it was received...sans encryption.
It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: The name of the parameter that is to be stored in the PHP SESSION.
The value of the parameter that is to be stored in the PHP SESSION.
